p: Whilst the unmitigated consequences from climate change are catastrophic, a hesitance persists in some courts to “overhaul industries”, as indicated by the Juliana case [67]. Despite pledges by many corporations to reach ‘net zero’ emissions by 2050, there is not yet any contractual or legal obligation to enforce this. The agreement at COP26 to establish rules for a global voluntary carbon market also raises complex issues about the ethics of carbon offsetting, and whether access to finance comes with a human rights and health cost for local and indigenous communities in low-income countries [104].
